archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: This collection contains a variety of American Egg Board publications, such as recipe cards and information brochures.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: American Egg Board Collection, Ms2009-124 - Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The American Egg Board Collection was donated to Special Collections in 2004.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the American Egg Board Collection commenced and was completed in September 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The American Egg Board is an organization that works with egg producers to successfully market eggs to the public. This nationally funded organization works to increase the public demand for eggs and egg products. Although the board is appointed by the U.S. Secretary of Agriculture, the board is made up of 18 representatives, as well as 18 alternates, from all areas of the country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains recipe cards featuring eggs as the main ingredient and educational pamphlets regarding the production, nutritional value, and preparation of eggs. Some of the topics covered in these pamphlets are: microwave preparation, egg facts and recipes for children and senior citizens, breakfast and brunch, ethnic, quick and easy, popular egg basics, questions about eggs, nutrition, economy, food safety, entertaining, and dieting. The collection contains approximately 100 different items.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection has been maintained in its original order.
